person.persName: Jeremiah Tilford Boyle (Military Governor of Kentucky)

body.p: An abolitionist, Boyle practiced law in Boyle County before the Civil War. He volunteered for the United States Army in 1861 and became a Brigadier General in November 1861. He was later appointed Military Governor of the District of Kentucky, a post which he held until he resigned it in 1864.
